Problem:

We investigate the impact of a control function \\( h(s) \\) added to the input function \\( f(s) \\), resulting in a modified input \\( f(s) + h(s) \\).

If at a particular time \\( s_1 \\), a control function \\( h(s) = e^{-s} \\) is applied, will the transformed output \\( I[f(t)] \\) be independent of the initial function \\( f(s) \\)?
Explanation: The addition of \\( h(s) = e^{-s} \\) as an intervention modifies the input, but the output \\( I[f(t)] \\) still depends on both the initial function \\( f(s) \\) and the control function due to the properties of linear superpositions in integral transformations.
